intro: Munroa andina var. breviseta, commonly known as the Andean short-stemmed muña, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and rockeries.
